intro: Polygala albicoma, commonly known as the white-stemmed milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Polygala albicoma is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
